content.description:
The  ElectricVehicle  class is used to store information about electric vehicles. A partial declaration of the  ElectricVehicle  class is shown.
 public class ElectricVehicle
{
 /** 
 * Returns the range of the vehicle, which is the distance, in miles, 
 * that the vehicle can travel on a fully charged battery
 */
 public int getRange()
 { /* implementation not shown */ }

/** 
 * Returns the model name of the vehicle
 */
 public String getModelName()
 { /* implementation not shown */ }

/* There may be instance variables, constructors,
 and methods that are not shown. */
}

The  EVDataSet  class maintains a list of electric vehicles. A partial declaration of the  EVDataSet  class is shown.
 public class EVDataSet
{
 private ArrayList <ElectricVehicle> vehicleList;

/**
 * Returns a list of the model names of electric vehicles whose range,
 * in miles, is greater than target, without any duplicate model names
 * Preconditions: vehicleList is not null.
 * No elements of vehicleList are null.
 * Postcondition: vehicleList is unchanged.
 */
 public ArrayList<String> getHighRangeVehicles(int target)
 { /* to be implemented */}

/* There may be instance variables, constructors,
 and methods that are not shown. */
}

Write the  EVDataSet  method  getHighRangeVehicles.  The method should return an  ArrayList  containing the model names of all electric vehicles in  vehicleList  whose range, in miles, is greater than the parameter  target.

There may be multiple vehicles in  vehicleList  with the same model name. If two vehicles have the same model name and both have a range greater than target, the model name should appear only once in the returned list. The model names can appear in any order in the returned  ArrayList.

Suppose  vehicleList  has the following contents.

The ArrayList has 6 elements.

Each element has the following attributes:

Range

Model Name

The following presents each element’s contents from left to right.

The elements in the ArrayList have the following contents:

Element 0:

Range: 200

Model Name: "Eco 6"

Element 1:

Range: 300

Model Name: "Hallo"

Element 2:

Range: 250

Model Name: "QTK2"

Element 3:

Range: 270

Model Name: "Nu EV"

Element 4:

Range: 220

Model Name: "QTK2"

Element 5:

Range: 190

Model Name: "Ekstat"

For the  vehicleList  shown,  getHighRangeVehicles(215)  should return an  ArrayList  containing the values  "Hallo",  "QTK2",  and  "Nu EV",  in any order.
content.question:
Complete method  getHighRangeVehicles.

 * Returns a list of the model names of electric vehicles whose range,
 * in miles, is greater than target, without any duplicate model names
 * Preconditions: vehicleList is not null.
 * No elements of vehicleList are null.
 * Postcondition: vehicleList is unchanged.
 */
public ArrayList<String> getHighRangeVehicles(int target)
